filmography.title: 12 Angry Men
filmography.role_description: A rational, analytical stockbroker who relies strictly on the facts and evidence, initially convinced of the defendant's guilt but willing to be swayed by logic.
filmography.plot: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence in a murder trial.
filmography.awards: Berlin International Film Festival: Win – Golden Bear; BAFTA: Win – Best Foreign Actor (Henry Fonda); AFI: 100 Years... 100 Movies (#87)

filmography.title: Interiors
filmography.role_description: A wealthy corporate lawyer who decides to leave his mentally unstable wife to pursue a new life, triggering a family crisis.
filmography.plot: Three sisters find their lives spinning out of control when their father unexpectedly announces he is separating from their mentally ill mother.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Director, Best Screenplay, Best Actress, Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Superman II
filmography.role_description: The President of the United States who is forced to kneel before the Kryptonian villain General Zod on national television.
filmography.plot: Superman agrees to sacrifice his powers to start a relationship with Lois Lane, unaware that three Kryptonian criminals have conquered Earth.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Win – Best Science Fiction Film

filmography.title: The Caine Mutiny
filmography.role_description: The stern but fair prosecutor in the court-martial of Lieutenant Maryk, tasked with proving the mutiny was unjustified.
filmography.plot: When a U.S. Naval captain shows signs of mental instability that endangers the ship, the executive officer relieves him of command and faces court-martial for mutiny.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Picture, Best Actor (Humphrey Bogart)

filmography.title: Creepshow
filmography.role_description: A cruel, germ-phobic business tycoon who lives in a hermetically sealed apartment and faces a gruesome invasion of cockroaches.
filmography.plot: An anthology of five horror tales inspired by E.C. Comics, featuring a wealthy man's battle with insects and a meteorite that brings alien plant life.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nominated – Best Horror Film

filmography.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
filmography.role_description: A dedicated U.S. Army intelligence officer who frantically tries to warn his superiors of the impending Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor and the series of American blunders that allowed it to happen.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Special Visual Effects

filmography.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
filmography.role_description: Clark Griswold's grumpy, hard-to-please father-in-law who adds to the family chaos during the holidays.
filmography.plot: The Griswold family's plans for a big family Christmas turn into a big disaster.

filmography.title: Compulsion
filmography.role_description: The relentless prosecutor determined to secure the death penalty for two brilliant students who committed a 'perfect crime'.
filmography.plot: Two wealthy law students kill a boy to prove they can get away with the perfect crime, but their arrogance leads to their downfall.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Actor (Dean Stockwell, Bradford Dillman, Orson Welles)

filmography.title: Nixon
filmography.role_description: Nixon's loyal Attorney General and campaign manager who becomes deeply embroiled in the Watergate scandal.
filmography.plot: A biographical story of former U.S. President Richard Nixon, from his days as a young boy to his eventual presidency which ended in shame.

filmography.title: Town Without Pity
filmography.role_description: The military prosecutor seeking the death penalty for four American soldiers accused of raping a German girl.
filmography.plot: Four American soldiers are court-martialed for raping a local girl in a German village, leading to a trial that exposes the town's hypocrisy.

filmography.title: Absolute Power
filmography.role_description: An elderly billionaire philanthropist and close friend of the President, whose wife is murdered in a political cover-up.
filmography.plot: A master thief witnesses a horrific crime involving the U.S. President and becomes a target of the Secret Service.

filmography.title: The Bridge at Remagen
filmography.role_description: A high-ranking U.S. officer who orders his troops to capture the last standing bridge across the Rhine.
filmography.plot: As the Allied armies advance into Germany, both sides fight for control of the last bridge over the Rhine River.

filmography.title: The Bachelor Party
filmography.role_description: A melancholy, asthmatic married man who joins a bachelor party and reveals his deep dissatisfaction with his life.
filmography.plot: A group of office workers throws a bachelor party for a colleague, leading to a night of drinking and painful self-revelation.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Supporting Actress (Carolyn Jones)

filmography.title: The Chase
filmography.role_description: A wealthy and powerful oil and cattle baron who practically owns a small Texas town and tries to protect his son.
filmography.plot: The escape of a local convict from prison disrupts the lives of the people in a small Texas town.

filmography.title: The Silver Chalice
filmography.role_description: A wealthy merchant in Antioch who adopts the protagonist Basil, setting the story in motion.
filmography.plot: A Greek artisan is commissioned to cast the cup of Christ in silver and sculpt the faces of the disciples and Jesus around its rim.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Cinematography, Best Score

filmography.title: Pushover
filmography.role_description: A police lieutenant leading a stakeout to catch a bank robber, unaware that one of his detectives has fallen for the robber's girlfriend.
filmography.plot: A cop falls for a bank robber's girlfriend and they plot to kill her boyfriend and take the money for themselves.

filmography.title: The Left Hand of God
filmography.role_description: A doctor at a remote Chinese mission who becomes suspicious of a new priest who is actually a downed American pilot in disguise.
filmography.plot: An American pilot crash-lands in China during World War II and disguises himself as a priest to escape a warlord.

filmography.title: Consenting Adults
filmography.role_description: The defense attorney hired to represent a man who has been framed for the murder of his neighbor's wife.
filmography.plot: A man is framed for murder after a wife-swapping arrangement with his manipulative new neighbors goes terribly wrong.

filmography.title: Two Evil Eyes
filmography.role_description: A lawyer involved in the legal affairs of a wealthy old man whose wife is scheming to steal his fortune.
filmography.plot: Two horror tales based on stories by Edgar Allan Poe, one involving a woman who hypnotizes her dying husband to sign over his money.

filmography.title: The Buccaneer
filmography.role_description: The Governor of Louisiana who must decide whether to trust the pirate Jean Lafitte to help defend New Orleans.
filmography.plot: During the War of 1812, pirate Jean Lafitte helps General Andrew Jackson defend New Orleans against the British.

filmography.title: The Mountain
filmography.role_description: A man from the village who is involved in the search and rescue efforts after a plane crash on a treacherous peak.
filmography.plot: A selfish man coerces his older brother, a retired climber, to help him plunder a plane that has crashed on Mont Blanc.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nominated – Best Foreign Actor (Spencer Tracy)

filmography.title: Broken Lance
filmography.role_description: The state governor who interacts with a powerful cattle baron whose family is tearing itself apart.
filmography.plot: A domineering cattle baron alienates his three oldest sons, leading to a family feud that threatens to destroy his empire.

filmography.title: The Poppy Is Also a Flower
filmography.role_description: An American narcotics agent working with the United Nations to track a shipment of radioactive opium to expose a drug ring.
filmography.plot: United Nations agents inject a shipment of opium with a radioactive compound to track it from Iran to the drug distributors in Europe.
filmography.awards: Emmy: Win – Best Supporting Actor (Eli Wallach)

filmography.title: Cash McCall
filmography.role_description: A business associate involved in the high-stakes corporate maneuvering surrounding a young tycoon.
filmography.plot: A man who buys failing businesses to sell them for a profit falls in love with the daughter of one of the company owners.

filmography.title: The Journey
filmography.role_description: One of a group of Western travelers detained by a Soviet officer during the Hungarian Revolution.
filmography.plot: A group of Westerners trying to leave Hungary during the 1956 revolution are detained by a Soviet commander who becomes fascinated by one of the passengers.
